deepDive.title: Low-Precision GPU Inference Research – INT8/FP8 Diffusion Model Acceleration
deepDive.summary: I'm working on research to accelerate neural network inference by pushing a 16-bit diffusion model down to low-precision formats such as INT8 and FP8, using CUDA, cuBLAS, and CUTLASS. The goal is to cut memory footprint and latency without sacrificing output quality.
body: I designed structured experiments to understand precision bottlenecks, learned GPU architecture and CUDA from first principles, and built several prototype kernels and PyTorch extensions to test different quantization paths.
I've implemented symmetric INT8 quantization for smaller networks, benchmarked FP8 variants, and proposed multiple feasible approaches for scaling these techniques to the full diffusion model.
focusAreas: cuBLAS GEMMEx and CUTLASS low-precision kernels
Performance benchmarking on modern NVIDIA architectures
